Guest Molecules.Molecule Name: bovine serum albumin tryptic digest peptides

Other Information.Additional Info: Hydrophobic-hydrophobic interactions play a role in the enrichment of peptides.
The size of BSA is larger than the pore size of Fe3O4@MIL-100(Fe), preventing it from entering the pores.
Peptides with sizes smaller than the pore size are allowed to enter the nanochannels while larger proteins are excluded.

Sieving Mechanism: Selective extraction of peptides and exclusion of high molecular weight proteins based on size.

Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: BSA tryptic digest: 22 peptides matched with 47.3% sequence coverage; Human serum: 563 unique peptides identified.

Other Information.Additional Info: The material combines porosity, hydrophobicity, large surface area, and quick magnetic separation for efficient peptide enrichment.
